title: nasus is anti-fun
body:
this isnt a nerf nasus thread hes not at all broken cause he has some huge weaknesses hes just so terrible to play against and i want to know what you guys think of it

* you have to dedicate the whole game to making sure he doesn't stack
* sometimes poking him feels totally pointless cause of grasp/passive heal
*  if you are playing a blind like a filthy casual for a fun non-serious game and you happen to pick someone who just does okay or badly against him there goes 30 minutes of your life (wow i just described any toxic champ in league)
* he gets kited really easily but getting flashed q'd as any squishy just sucks
* towers do like 0 damage to him once hes level 6 and they get shredded so easily
* the slow/ attack speed slow isnt broken, but its just toxic to play against
* if youre jg is braindead and doesnt gank you cant get a lead unless you are a counter to his champ
* you wont always be able to perfectly freeze a lane so he'll eventually reached a threshhold where you just cant 1v1 him anymore and there goes enjoying yourself for the rest of the game

overall, nasus is not broken i just think that hes pretty terrible and boring to play against i just cant see anyone actually enjoying themselves playing against this champion, he just does nothing till some point in mid/late game where you cant fight him alone anymore so you have to just run away

i know im gonna get downvoted and told: "lol silver skrub git gud" but im seriously wondering how people have fun against this champion

I agree with this, and I think discussion on Nasus's gameplay health in the past has been bogged down by the fact that he is neither popular nor exceptionally successful. He is not overpowered, but he nonetheless feels boring to play against. As is the case with many other frustrating champions, his basic counterplay is pretty simple (bully him all the time and don't ever let him stack), but isn't fun, and as a result he tends to suck the fun out of the games he's in. Stacks aren't what makes Nasus Q hurt. The base damage + {{item:3078}} is what makes it hurt.

This is why Nasus is a mid game champ and not a late game champ as opposed to what people may think. Stacks aren't that powerful. His powerspike is when he gets Trinity Force and he slowly falls off from there. His scaling, albeit infinite, scales so slowly it doesn't even matter.

And lategame a Nasus with 400 stacks vs 800 stacks is still gonna get melted regardless in the blink of an eye by your ADC.
